required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Extracorporal Shock Wave Treatment to Improve Nerve Regeneration
clinical_study.official_title: Extracorporal Shock Wave Treatment After Microsurgical Coaptation to Improve Nerve Regeneration

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the impact of extracorporeal shock wave treatment after microsurgical coaptation of finger nerves. Participants will be randomized into two treatment groups with different settings and a sham group. The participants will thereafter followed-up in a prospective, double-blind study design.

detailed_description.textblock:
Extracorporeal shock wave treatment is CE certified in Austria, Europe and licensed for indications like achillodynia, epicondylitis, or tendinitis calcanea. The Orthogold 100 device by MTS Medical UG will be used for this study.
Defocused low-energy extracorporeal shock wave therapy (ESWT) has gained acceptance as a therapeutic tool in different medical settings. It has been shown, that shock waves stimulate of the metabolic activity of different cell type, including osteoblasts, tenocytes, endothelial cells and chondrocytes. Furthermore, it has proved effective in clinical applications relating to bone and wound healing and myocardial ischaemia. Until now, no studies have been performed regarding the effects of ESWT on regeneration of peripheral nerve injuries in humans.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be randomized into three groups: Two treatment groups with different treatment settings and one sham group.
study_design_info.masking_description: The participant will be wearing an acoustic and visual masking. The outcome assessor won't know if the participant was treated or if he was assigned to the sham group.

primary_outcome.description: Two Point Discrimination distal of the nerve lesion in mm

secondary_outcome.description: Progression of TH sign into the periphery
sonography of the coaptation neuroma, measurement of the maximum diameter in mm
Determination of velocity of nerve conduction

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Research Council Grading of Sensibility
secondary_outcome.description: Grading by the british medical research council. S0: No recovery of sensibility S1: Deep cutaneous pain sensibility S1+: superficial pain sensibility S2: superficial pain and some touch sensibility S2+: As in S2 but with overresponse S3: Pain and touch sensibility with over response, 2PD > 15mm S3+: As S3 but with imperfect recovery of 2PD (7-15mm) S4: Complete recovery

arm_group.description: 300 pulses of extracorporeal shock wave will be applied
500 pulses of extracorporeal shock wave will be applied

intervention.description: Extracorporeal shock wave treatment will be faked.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- complete lossless transection of one or more digital nerves distal to the branching out of the commune median or ulnar nerves
- direct, tension-free coaptation of the nerve stumps
Exclusion Criteria:
- segment loss of the nerve
- tension after direct coaptation
- diabetic neuropathy or other peripheral neuropathies
- other disease with reduced sensibility of the fingers
- injuries in the course of the nerve (plexus brachialis, median or ulnar nerve)
- chronic inflammatory disease
- rheumatoid arthritis
- pregnancy
- patients not able to give written consent
- patients with an implantable cardiac defibrillator or pacemaker
- patients which are sensitive to electromagnetic radiance
